relationships.description: Founder and coordinator of the populist foundation
Courting and coordinating with nationalist leaders across Europe
Email correspondence about European political operations

analysis.purpose: To discuss Steve Bannon's European political operations and share media coverage about his new foundation 'The Movement'
analysis.significance: Reveals Bannon's strategic plans to coordinate European populist movements ahead of 2019 elections and his ongoing relationship with Jeffrey Epstein

notable_quotes: "If you are going to play here , you'll have to spend time, europe by remote doesn't work . Lots and lots of face time and hand holding"
"Better to reign in Hell than to serve in Paradise," Bannon says now paraphrasing the Satan of one of his favorite books, John Milton's Lost Paradise.
"The ambition of Steve Bannon... is therefore to become the coordinator of the one great 'populist international' of which he has long since been dreaming."
red_flags: Reference to Cambridge Analytica data scandal
Coordination of far-right political movements across international borders

blackmail_indicators.description: No indicators of blackmail or coercion found in this communication

illegal_activity.description: This email chain contains forwarded news articles about Steve Bannon's political activities, not first-hand illegal activity by the participants

details: Mention of Michael Wolff's book 'Fire and Fury'
Media coverage of Bannon's European political plans

public_knowledge.context: Steve Bannon's political activities and relationships with European right-wing leaders were widely covered in media during this period

analysis.summary: This email chain between Steve Bannon and Jeffrey Epstein discusses Bannon's European political operations, including his new foundation 'The Movement' aimed at coordinating populist right-wing parties ahead of 2019 European elections, with forwarded media coverage detailing his strategic ambitions and relationships with European nationalist leaders.
